intro: Cyclophorus scytopteris, commonly known as the common cyclophorus, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or greenish flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
